channel.title: Jobs
channel.description:
I ended up totaling my car Sunday night, it was only a $2,000 car but I made all that money myself. So it got me thinking, what jobs could make $2,000 in around 4-6 months?
Suggestions (inb4prostitute)

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

I will be getting like 15$ an hour or more depending on how far I go in my career choice.

I am planning on being a Paramedic with the firedepo. I start getting my EMT classes out of the way next year when I am 18.

Read full topic

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Just more money to spend and higher taxes.

If you want to live nice, you spend.

Read full topic

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:40, topic:432061”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=534770.msg3910636#msg3910636 date=1328686851]

In Canada, minimum wage is 10.50 an hour. When I got a job ( finally ) I work from 4:00 pm till close every day, cept weekends. So, move to Canada niglet.

Wow, starting to like Canada right now, plus then add in that the Canadian dollar is slightly higher the the USA’s in global value.
[/quote]

As usual, higher the minimum wage, higher the cost of living.[/quote]

Where you are wrong mate, I know my family’s monetary expenses. Heres about what we pay.

$100.00 for food for a month.
$900.00 for rent.
$50.00 for t.v
$30.00 for internet.
$20.00 for phone.

An average Canadian family has a working father + mother, totalling at around $20.00 for each Working 40 hour weeks. So around $1600 dollars every 2 weeks. And that’s average, without degrees or a good job. so $3200.00 a month, with adding the total expenses above you get $2100.00 left over.
(We used an american address for insurance, so I can’t count it)

Read full topic

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @KingoftheCastle KingoftheCastle
item.description:
@KingoftheCastle wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:36, topic:432061”][quote author=KingoftheCastle link=topic=534770.msg3910450#msg3910450 date=1328668824]

Currently once spring picks up I mow 2-3 peoples lawn and make around $90 extra per week. I have no bad habits (maybe getting food at my current employer), and my work is LITERALLY 2 minutes away from my house.

I’m not trying to start anything here but asking how to make 2k in 4_6 months is eh…
That’s basically asking how do I get a job…doing ANYTHING sorry but I had to post this
good to know your mowin lawns. My friend does lawn care and gets a nice vacation in the winter no income though
[/quote]When you in high school paying for a phone + car insurance is around $200 dollars a month, and if you would have read I currently only work 10 hours a week.[/quote]
I said I wasn’t trying to start anything yet you still try to be a smartass. You didnt put that in your original post which would have made a lot more sense… What insurance? You have no car and you might as well keep that job. your in highschool. Don’t expect any place to give you a lot of hours

Read full topic

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:43, topic:432061”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=534770.msg3910683#msg3910683 date=1328697754]

In Canada, minimum wage is 10.50 an hour. When I got a job ( finally ) I work from 4:00 pm till close every day, cept weekends. So, move to Canada niglet.

Wow, starting to like Canada right now, plus then add in that the Canadian dollar is slightly higher the the USA’s in global value.

As usual, higher the minimum wage, higher the cost of living.

True, plus I don’t think I would be able to live with a data cap on my internet.
[/quote]Last time i checked, most countries have datacaps and absurd prices, except for scandinavia and Japan :)[/quote]
Well Japan controls their media and porn. So that’s a no no.

Read full topic

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:29, topic:432061”]Alot of the phone technologies etc came from here though yes? Cause of apple, microsoft creating all that shit. If they wouldnt have known they could make a future with their ideas they wouldnt have persued[/quote]Actually Nokia dominated the market when they started pushing around 2000. The idea of doing something other than calling with your phone was popularized by them and Ericsson (which was Swedish at the time, before Sony purchased them).

Read full topic

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

Speljohan:

Any job would make you far more than that in a sane country. I make $3.4k/month from an entry level job that requires no education.

I still cry over the fact that we left Sweden and came to the Americas
Where life seems to get harder every 1s
